text: the Houthis are usually described as
Shia ha Muslim rebels based in the north
of the country bordering Saudi Arabia
they started off as a peaceful movement
back in the 1990s but today they have
thousands of Fighters back in September
2014 they overrun the capital and now
they hold several territories around the
country
over the course of 10 years there have
been six wars between the Houthis and
the government led by outside President
Ali Abdullah Saleh the Houthis were
asking for more autonomy and they blamed
the government for the underdevelopment
of their region but to complicate things
further there is also tribal score
settling going on that sometimes has
nothing to do with politics or religion
why is this happening now we're not sure
but what we know is that the Arab Spring
in Yemen resulted in a weak government
and the new President Abdullah bones all
had now what actually happened is that
forces loyal to the former president
have teamed up with their old enemy the
Houthis and they've both managed to
chase the government out of the country
